Summary Dedicated Professional in Human Resources with 10+ years of increasing responsibilities and achievements in HR within the service, manufacturing and healthcare environments. Past experience includes the continuing education, training, and certification of new and existing employees.  
Proven success in building relationships with people at all levels. 
Looking for opportunities at an organization that values diversity and supports and encourages employees to develop their full potential. Specialties:Bilingual English/Spanish, employee training and development and implementation of internal policies and procedures. Experience Administrative Assistant, Center for Nursing Excellence Stanford Children's Health | Lucile Packard Children's Hospital Stanford April 2012  –  April 2013  (1 year 1 month) Menlo Park Provide a full range of administrative, clerical and office support for the Versant® RN Residency program and Residency managers. 
 
Coordinate scheduling and communications in conjunction with the Residency managers. 
 
Communicate with nurse managers, educators, and other key individuals instrumental in making the RN Residency successful. 
 
Take minutes during the Leadership Group meetings and distribute to all appropriate participants. 
 
Assist the Residency manager as site administrator for Versant Voyager®, the RN Residency web-based management system. 
 
Work with Clinical Nurse Specialists and Educators to update, reformat and upload RN competencies on Intranet. 
 
Manage the logistics of educational events, seminars and conferences. Human Resources Coordinator UHA/Menlo Medical Clinic August 2011  –  March 2012  (8 months) Menlo Park Handle a broad range of administrative and HR support functions, including handling inquiries and data entry related to payroll, benefits, LOAs, NHO, Workers’ Comp, SDI, personal time off, policies & procedures.  
 
Assist in program with ongoing monitoring of performance reviews, benefits, open enrollment and audits for HRIS, EZLabor, and HRB.  
 
Conduct new hire orientation and served as primary user for all HR systems and HRIS system records maintenance.  
 
Interface with a number of business partners, including Staffing, Finance, Benefits, Payroll, Facilities, Clinical and Corporate staff. Human Resources Generalist Stanford University Medical Center February 2010  –  February 2011  (1 year 1 month) Serve as point of contact for employee and management questions regarding HR policies, benefits, processes and other human resource related matters. 
 
Assist with the administration and management of on-boarding and New Employee Orientation processes for hospital employees and House Staff. 
 
Provide one-on-one assistance to employees during the annual benefits open enrollment process. 
 
Review and make recommendations for process improvements, automation of information and services, system applications, operational efficiency and customer service. 
 
Process new employee data and audit documentation, including I-9 and licensing for accuracy, adherence to policies/guidelines, proper signature authorization and completeness. Corporate Recruiter Indusys Technology, Inc. January 2009  –  May 2009  (5 months) Researched and used cost effective methods for recruiting direct staff and sub-contractors across the United States. 
 
Developed and assisted with the implementation of internal company policies and procedures. 
 
Provided HR guidance to executive and management team. Employee Services Representative Flagship Facilities Services, Inc. November 2001  –  July 2008  (6 years 9 months) The company changed its name as of June, 2008 from Service Performance Corporation to Flagship Facility Services, Inc.  
 
Provided internal consultant services to management concerning employee relations, performance management and the interpretation of and enforcement of California and Federal Labor Law. 
 
Investigated employee issues and concerns while maintaining a high degree of confidentiality. 
 
Designed, developed and delivered comprehensive training programs to improve supervisor/management competencies. 
 
Traveled to remote locations to deliver and implement training programs and internal policies. 
 
Managed and maintained the Training and Development module on HRIS system. Human Resources Representative Toyota Tsusho America January 2000  –  December 2000  (1 year) Provided HR leadership for the West Coast Region of the United States and assisted in the implementation of HR initiatives.  
 
Established the HR function to support employees at five locations in the West Coast.  
 
Resolved issues/concerns raised by employees at all levels in the organization, providing guidance in regards to HR law. 
 
Established and maintained strong communications with labor union representatives; participated in collective bargaining agreement negotiations. Human Resources Site Manager Service Performance Corp. September 1997  –  December 2000  (3 years 4 months) Provided HR guidance company-wide in achievement of business objectives.  
Responsible for recruiting, hiring and training employees at all levels. 
Served as liaison between the Company and labor union to effectively address situations affecting both parties. 
Redesigned and helped deliver New Hire Orientation program for employee base of 1,100. 
Maintained accurate HR records and employee files. Training Specialist Komag, Inc. 1988  –  1997  (9 years) Responsible for evaluating, implementing, administering and delivering training programs.
